availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Al. D. Hynes (Nelson County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Hynes. Father of Howard Hynes, Florence Hynes, and Nannie Hynes. Physician in Nelson County in 1860. Enrolled as a First Lieutenant in the 4th Kentucky Veteran Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) in 1863, but never mustered into service. Identifies as an adjutant of the Capital Guard Regiment in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District no. 1, p. 182.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 454.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 926.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 043.
